title: Pavel Antov, Founder of Russian Meat Company, Dies in India
description: The body of the millionaire Pavel Antov, who had reportedly criticized the Russian shelling of civilians in Kyiv, was found outside his hotel.

title: Ukraine and Russia Battle for a Gateway City in the East
description: Recapturing Kreminna, in eastern Ukraine, would be a step further in Ukraine’s campaign to retake major cities that Russia seized after it invaded.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: China’s Overwhelmed Hospitals
description: Also, Ukraine is fighting to retake a city in the Donbas.

title: Airline Meltdowns in Recent History
description: Flight delays and cancellations over the holiday weekend have left thousands of passengers stranded. Here’s a look at a few other notable episodes like it in recent memory.

title: Lukashenko and Putin Affirm Their Close Ties Without Mention of Ukraine
description: Their meeting could add to fears that Moscow will try to draw Belarus, Ukraine’s northern neighbor, more directly into the war.

title: Ukraine’s Battered Economy Leaves It More Reliant on Foreign Aid.
description: Unable to roll over debt accumulated before the war, Ukraine has paid investors more than it has collected this year, the Central Bank says.

title: Ukraine Pushes to Recapture City in Hotly Contested Northern Luhansk
description: Kyiv’s campaign to take back Kreminna began in the autumn. Russia controls most of the Luhansk region, one of four it illegally annexed in October.

title: Navalny Accuses Russian Prison Authorities of Using His Health as a Tool to Put Pressure on Him
description: The jailed Russian opposition leader said that he had been injected with unknown medication and accused the authorities of withholding his medical records.

title: Lee Myung-bak, South Korean Ex-President, Receives Pardon
description: The action by the current president, Yoon Suk Yeol, will release Mr. Lee from a 17-year sentence for bribery and embezzlement and nullify the enormous fines he owed.

title: Stories You Might Have Missed in 2022
description: Today we share stories that stood out to our editors but that you might have missed.

title: ‘Tragic Battle’: On the Front Lines of China’s Covid Crisis
description: Medical staff are outnumbered and working sick as the nation’s health care system buckles under the strain of a spiraling crisis.

title: Nicaragua no era un país de emigrantes. Ahora la historia es distinta
description: Cientos de miles de nicaragüenses han huido de su país en los últimos años, para escapar de la pobreza y la represión de un gobierno cada vez más autoritario.

title: Nicaraguans Join the Mass of People Migrating to the U.S.
description: Hundreds of thousands of Nicaraguans have fled their country in recent years, escaping poverty and repression under an increasingly authoritarian government.

title: You’re Going to Need a Smaller Boat: Island Hopping in the Grenadines
description: Forget about flying if you want to visit many of these stunning specks of land sprinkled across the Caribbean. Hop on a sailboat or a ferry, or you can always swim.

title: The Webb Telescope Is Just Getting Started
description: The first scientific results are coming in, and the $10 billion instrument is working even better than astronomers had dared to hope.

title: Epidemics That Weren’t: How Countries Shut Down Recent Outbreaks
description: Some of the most fragile health systems in the world can teach us ways to respond to public health threats early and effectively.

title: Ryazan, Home of Elite Russian Unit, Still Supports Ukraine War
description: Ryazan, not far from Moscow, regularly sends young men off to fight. Some are now buried in the local cemetery, but there is no surge of outrage against Russian leaders.
